sentences.english: an airline pilot
sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

detailed_translations.english: a company that takes passengers and goods to different places by plane

sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

sentences.english: a terminal branch of a tree
sentences.chinese: 树顶枝条

sentences.english: terminal examinations (= at the end of a course, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 期终考试

sentences.english: the airport’s passenger terminal
sentences.chinese: 机场航站楼

detailed_translations.english: at the end of sth

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔飞机、公共汽车、轮船客运或货物运输的〕集散站，终点站
detailed_translations.english: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded

sentences.chinese: 我仍在纽约，正在办理去俄罗斯的签证。

detailed_translations.english: an official mark put on your passport that gives you permission to temporarily enter or leave a foreign country

name: aisle
trans: (教堂、剧院、火车等的)过道,(超市架之间的)走道

sentences.english: Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat (=  seat next to the aisle  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 您想要靠窗的座位还是靠过道的座位？

detailed_translations.english: a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theatre etc, or between rows of shelves in a shop

name: board
trans: 登机, 等船, 上火车, 汽车等

sentences.english: a board meeting
sentences.chinese: 董事会会议

sentences.english: a board member
sentences.chinese: 董事会成员

detailed_translations.english: a group of people in a company or other organization who make the rules and important decisions

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

sentences.english: Flights by Air Europe depart Gatwick on Tuesdays.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲航空公司的航班每逢周二从盖特威克机场起飞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离开；出发，起程；违反；去世
detailed_translations.english: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

sentences.english: Slow down or you'll get a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 开慢点儿，否则你会接到一张罚款通知单。

sentences.english: parking/speeding ticket
sentences.chinese: 违法停车/超速行驶罚款单

detailed_translations.english: a printed note ordering you to pay money because you have done something illegal while driving or parking your car

sentences.english: Two lucky employees won a round-the-world trip.
sentences.chinese: 两名幸运的雇员赢得一次环游世界的机会。

sentences.english: It’s an 80-mile round trip (= a journey to a place and back again ) to Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 到埃克塞特往返有80英里。

sentences.english: I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip (= a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose ) . Mr Burgess has already left.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕你是白来一趟了，伯吉斯先生已经走了。

sentences.english: He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.
sentences.chinese: 他无法前去领奖。

detailed_translations.english: a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose
to hit something with your foot by accident so that you fall or almost fall

name: pack
trans: 收拾行李, 把... 打包

sentences.english: I forgot to pack my razor.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记把剃须刀放入行李包了。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people packed into the mosque.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千的人挤进了清真寺。

sentences.english: Send away for your free information pack today.
sentences.chinese: 今天就来函索取免费资料包吧。

detailed_translations.english: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
something wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere

sentences.english: They searched his luggage for illegal drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他们搜查他的行李看是否藏有毒品。

detailed_translations.english: the cases, bags etc that you carry when you are travelling

sentences.english: I’ve just started reading a book by Graham Greene.
sentences.chinese: 我刚开始看格雷厄姆·格林写的一本书。

sentences.english: a cookery book
sentences.chinese: 烹饪书

sentences.english: Have you booked a holiday this year?
sentences.chinese: 你今年有没有预订去度假？

detailed_translations.english: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them
to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

sentences.english: The plane landed at Heathrow Airport.
sentences.chinese: 飞机降落在希思罗机场。

sentences.english: Her family went to see her off at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 她的家人去机场送她。

detailed_translations.english: a place where planes take off and land, with buildings for passengers to wait in

sentences.english: We went through the gate into the orchard.
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过大门进了果园。

sentences.english: the wrought-iron gates of the palace
sentences.chinese: 宫殿的锻铁大门

detailed_translations.english: the part of a fence or outside wall that you can open and close so that you can enter or leave a place
to provide with a gate or gates

sentences.english: the New York City subway
sentences.chinese: 纽约市的地铁

sentences.english: a crowded subway station
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的地铁站

sentences.english: Boston has the oldest subway system in the US.
sentences.chinese: 波士顿拥有美国最老的地铁运输系统。

detailed_translations.english: a railway system that runs under the ground below a big city

name: option
trans: 选择, 选择权, 选择自由

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

sentences.english: It is a big airline with a large fleet of planes.
sentences.chinese: 这是一家大航空公司，拥有庞大的机群。

sentences.english: It’s much quicker to go by plane.
sentences.chinese: 乘飞机去会快很多。

sentences.english: She slept on the plane.
sentences.chinese: 她在飞机上睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that flies in the air and has wings and at least one engine

sentences.english: ‘Lunch? ’ ‘No thanks, I've already eaten. ’
sentences.chinese: “午餐？”“不，谢谢，我已吃过了。”

sentences.english: We got there early but Mike had already left.
sentences.chinese: 我们及早到了那里，但是迈克已经离开了。

detailed_translations.english: before now or before a particular time in the pas

sentences.english: Nothing ever seems to upset him.
sentences.chinese: 似乎从来没有什么事情会使他烦恼。

sentences.english: Have you ever been to Paris?
sentences.chinese: 你去过巴黎吗？

sentences.english: I don’t think I’ve ever been here before.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我以前从未到过这里。

sentences.english: It was raining harder than ever.
sentences.chinese: 当时下着前所未有的大雨。

detailed_translations.english: used in negative sentences and questions, or sentences with if to mean ‘at any time’

sentences.english: I saw Peter as I was getting off the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我下公共汽车的时候看见了彼得。

sentences.english: As time passed, things seemed to get worse.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推移，情况似乎变得更加糟糕了。

sentences.english: Just as the two men were leaving, a message arrived.
sentences.chinese: 那两个男子刚要离开，消息就传来了。

detailed_translations.english: while or when

sentences.english: He immediately booked a flight to Toulouse.
sentences.chinese: 他当即就订了去图卢兹的航班。

sentences.english: In 1968, the first supersonic airliner took flight (= began flying ) .
sentences.chinese: 1968年，首架超音速客机飞上天空。

sentences.english: When the alarm sounded, the whole gang took flight.
sentences.chinese: 警报响起，一帮人全逃跑了。

detailed_translations.english: a journey in a plane or space vehicle, or the plane or vehicle that is making the journey

name: unattended
trans: 没人看守的,没人管理的

sentences.english: Supervisors in this unit group supervise and co-ordinate activities of truck drivers, bus drivers, delivery drivers, subway and other transit operators, chauffeurs and taxi and limousine drivers.
sentences.chinese: 本单元组主管监督和协调卡车司机，巴士司机，送货司机，地铁及其他交通营办商，司机，出租车和豪华轿车司机的活动。

sentences.english: In 1992, George Bush visited Australia and, from the window of his limousine, held up his index and middle fingers in the "V" shape, a la Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 1992年，乔治·布什拜访澳大利的时候，效仿温斯顿·丘吉尔，从豪华的轿车里伸出食指和中指作出“V”字形的手势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大型轿车， 大型豪华轿车
detailed_translations.english: a very large, expensive, and comfortable car, driven by someone who is paid to drive

name: shuttle
trans: 穿梭班机﹑ 公共汽车

sentences.english: He took the Washington - New York shuttle.
sentences.chinese: 他乘坐华盛顿－纽约的往返班机。

detailed_translations.english: to travel frequently between two places

detailed_translations.chinese: 短程穿梭运行的飞机；航天飞机；梭子
detailed_translations.english: a  space shuttle
to travel frequently between two places

sentences.english: What right does Customs have to search my car?
sentences.chinese: 海关有什么权力搜查我的车？

detailed_translations.chinese: 海关；风俗（custom的复数）；习惯；关税
detailed_translations.english: Customs is the official organization responsible for collecting taxes on goods coming into a country and preventing illegal goods from being brought in

sentences.english: ‘When’s your holiday?’ ‘Oh, not for ages yet.’
sentences.chinese: “你什么时候去休假？”“噢，不知何年何月呢。”

sentences.english: It could be months yet before they know their fate.
sentences.chinese: 可能要好几个月他们才能知道自己的命运。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how much time will pass before something happens, or how long a situation will continue
used to introduce a fact, situation, or quality that is surprising after what you have just said

sentences.english: an exciting discovery
sentences.chinese: 激动人心的发现

sentences.english: ‘Julia and Paul are getting married!’ ‘Oh, how exciting!’
sentences.chinese: “朱莉娅和保罗要结婚了！”“啊，太让人兴奋了！”

sentences.english: I’ve got some very exciting news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我给你带来了一些很激动人心的消息。

sentences.english: Let’s do something exciting.
sentences.chinese: 我们来做些让人振奋的事情吧。

sentences.english: Melanie finds her work exciting and rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 梅拉妮觉得自己的工作既刺激又有意义。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel excited

sentences.english: We can walk to my house from here. It isn’t far.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以从这里步行去我家，不远。

sentences.english: You could see the mountains in the far distance.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到远处的群山。

sentences.english: Since I changed jobs, I have to travel further to get to work.
sentences.chinese: 我换了工作，上班更远了。

detailed_translations.english: a long distance away
a long distance

sentences.english: He was a hard-working, honest man.
sentences.chinese: 他勤奋老实。

sentences.english: Ann had an honest face.
sentences.chinese: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

sentences.english: black trousers teamed with a bright shirt
sentences.chinese: 配亮色衬衫的黑裤子

sentences.english: You can team up with one other class member if you want.
sentences.chinese: 例句：如果你愿意的话，可以找一个同学组成一组。

detailed_translations.english: to put two things or people together, because they will look good or work well together

sentences.english: The purpose is to build new houses for local people.
sentences.chinese: 目的是要为当地居民建造新的住宅。

sentences.english: The road took many years to build.
sentences.chinese: 这条路修了好几年。

sentences.english: They needed $3 million to build the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要300万美元来修建这座桥。

sentences.english: It is the female birds that build the nests.
sentences.chinese: 筑巢的是雌鸟。

sentences.english: She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她已经树立起了刑事诉讼律师的声望。

sentences.english: She’s been busy building her career.
sentences.chinese: 她忙于创建自己的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to make something, especially a building or something large

name: so
trans: 因此, 所以, 因而, 从而

sentences.english: The troops will not advance until ordered to do so .
sentences.chinese: 在接到命令之前，部队不会前进。

sentences.english: Did Luke sell them? And, if so , what happened to the money?
sentences.chinese: 卢克把它们卖了吗？如果是这样的话，那钱到哪里去了？

sentences.english: ‘Has he lost a fortune?’ ‘ So they say .’
sentences.chinese: “他输掉了一大笔钱吗？”“他们是这么说的。”

sentences.english: ‘Look – I’ve even cleaned the windows.’ ‘ So I see .’
sentences.chinese: “瞧，我把窗子也擦干净了。”“我看到了。”

sentences.english: Parents can withdraw their child from school if they so wish .
sentences.chinese: 家长要是愿意，可以让孩子退学。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer back to an idea, action, quality, situation etc that has just been mentioned
used to say that someone does something because of the reason just stated

name: most
trans: (用以构成形容词或副词的最高级)最

sentences.english: Which class has the most children in it?
sentences.chinese: 哪个班级孩子最多？

sentences.english: She’s one of the most experienced teachers in the district.
sentences.chinese: 她是该地区最有经验的教师之一。

detailed_translations.english: a larger amount or number than anyone or anything else
having the greatest amount of a particular quality

sentences.english: Everything I had heard about him was true.
sentences.chinese: 我所听到的关于他的一切都是真的。

sentences.english: He said it was true that a collision had happened.
sentences.chinese: 他说碰撞真的发生了一次。

detailed_translations.english: If something is true, it is based on facts rather than being invented or imagined, and is accurate and reliable

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

sentences.english: The zoo asked its visitors to suggest a name for the new baby panda.
sentences.chinese: 动物园请游客提建议，给刚出生的大熊猫起一个名字。

sentences.english: It has been suggested that the manager will resign if any more players are sold.
sentences.chinese: 有人提议，如果再有球员被出售，球队主教练就辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，建议；启发；使人想起；显示；暗示
detailed_translations.english: to tell someone your ideas about what they should do, where they should go etc

sentences.english: He won the best actor award.
sentences.chinese: 他获得最佳男演员奖。

sentences.english: What’s the best way to cook this fish?
sentences.chinese: 这鱼怎么烧最好？

sentences.english: The best thing to do is to stop worrying.
sentences.chinese: 最好的办法就是不要再担心。

sentences.english: Our pilots are given the best possible training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞行员接受最好的训练。

sentences.english: We use only the very best ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 我们只用最好的原料。

detailed_translations.english: better than anything else or anyone else in quality, skill, how effective it is etc

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票

sentences.english: the cheapest TV on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上最便宜的电视机

sentences.english: Property is cheaper in Spain than here.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的房地产比这里便宜。

sentences.english: a cheap shop (= one that sells goods cheaply )
sentences.chinese: 廉价商店

sentences.english: The equipment is relatively cheap and simple to use.
sentences.chinese: 这种设备相对比较便宜，而且操作简单。

sentences.english: Cheap wine gives me a headache.
sentences.chinese: 我喝劣质的葡萄酒会头痛。

detailed_translations.english: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected

sentences.english: They live near London.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在伦敦附近。

sentences.english: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.english: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.english: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.english: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
sentences.chinese: 我警告你别再靠近！

sentences.english: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

detailed_translations.english: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something

sentences.english: the most expensive restaurant in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最贵的餐馆

sentences.english: Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.
sentences.chinese: 汽油越来越贵了。

sentences.english: Photography is an expensive hobby.
sentences.chinese: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。

sentences.english: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).
sentences.chinese: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。

sentences.english: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.
sentences.chinese: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。

sentences.english: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。

detailed_translations.english: costing a lot of money

sentences.english: ...a slide projector.
sentences.chinese: …幻灯机。

detailed_translations.chinese: [仪] 投影仪；放映机；探照灯；设计者
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a film or picture appear on a screen or flat surface

sentences.english: We’re having a meeting next week to discuss the matter.
sentences.chinese: 我们下周将开会讨论此事。

sentences.english: I had felt drawn to Alice ever since our first meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次见到艾丽斯就感觉被她吸引住了

detailed_translations.english: an event at which people meet to discuss and decide things

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

sentences.english: the personnel department
sentences.chinese: 人事部

sentences.english: the English department
sentences.chinese: 英语系

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government

name: venue
trans: 聚集地点; 会场; (尤指)体育比赛场所

sentences.english: The first thing to do is book a venue.
sentences.chinese: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。

sentences.english: The band will play (= perform at ) as many venues as possible.
sentences.chinese: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

detailed_translations.english: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place

sentences.english: the presentation ceremony
sentences.chinese: 颁奖仪式

sentences.english: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供， 显示； 外观， 图像； 授予， 赠送； 报告， 介绍； 表演
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

sentences.english: It took us ages to choose a new carpet.
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选新地毯花了很长时间。

sentences.english: A panel of judges will choose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 会由一个评判小组选出冠军。

sentences.english: He chose his words carefully as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他说话时字斟句酌。

sentences.english: You can, if you choose, invest in the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，可以投资股票市场。

detailed_translations.english: to decide which one of a number of things or people you want

sentences.english: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

sentences.english: Your stereo is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的音响比我的好。

sentences.english: There must be a better way to do this.
sentences.chinese: 一定还有更好的办法来做这件事。

sentences.english: He can speak French a lot better than I can.
sentences.chinese: 他法语讲得比我好多了。

detailed_translations.english: more useful, interesting, satisfactory, effective, suitable etc
to a higher standard or quality

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 救护车服务

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: [车辆][医] 救护车；战时流动医院
detailed_translations.english: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

name: seem
trans: 看上去, 像是, 似乎

sentences.english: Ann didn’t seem very sure.
sentences.chinese: 安看来并不十分肯定。

sentences.english: It seems a foolish decision now.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来这是一个愚蠢的决定。

sentences.english: It seems like you’re catching a cold, Taylor.
sentences.chinese: 你好像感冒了，泰勒。

sentences.english: ‘So Bill’s leaving her?’ ‘ So it seems (= that seems to be true ) .’
sentences.chinese: “这么说来，比尔要离开她？”“好像是这样。”

detailed_translations.english: if something seems to be true, there are qualities or facts that make people think it is true

sentences.english: There’s a short poem at the beginning of every chapter.
sentences.chinese: 每一章的开头都有一首短诗。

sentences.english: From the beginning of my career as a journalist, I’ve been writing about gender issues.
sentences.chinese: 从我一开始干记者这一行，我就写性别议题的题材。

sentences.english: I thought he loved me; perhaps he did in the beginning .
sentences.chinese: 我以为他爱我，也许开始时他确实是爱我的。

sentences.english: That chance meeting marked the beginning of a long and happy relationship.
sentences.chinese: 那次邂逅展开了一段长久而幸福的关系。

sentences.english: This is just the beginning of a new and different life for you.
sentences.chinese: 这只是你新的别样生活的开始。

sentences.english: I said he would cause trouble, right from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就说过，他会惹事。

sentences.english: I opposed it from the very beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就反对。

sentences.english: The whole trip was a disaster from beginning to end.
sentences.chinese: 旅途从头到尾都在出乱子。

sentences.english: I think I have the beginnings of a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉要感冒了。

sentences.english: He rose from humble beginnings to great wealth.
sentences.chinese: 他出身卑微，如今已腰缠万贯。

detailed_translations.english: the start or first part of an event, story, period of time etc

sentences.english: I’m going out for a bit – I’ll see you later.
sentences.chinese: 我出去一会儿——回头见。

detailed_translations.english: after the time you are talking about or after the present time

sentences.english: The next six months will be the hardest.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的六个月将是最难熬的。

sentences.english: The man in the next chair was asleep.
sentences.chinese: 邻座的男子睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: coming straight after sb/sth in time, order or space

sentences.english: After the war many soldiers stayed in France.
sentences.chinese: 战后，许多士兵留在法国。

sentences.english: I go swimming every day after work.
sentences.chinese: 我每天下班后都去游泳。

sentences.english: Do you believe in life after death?
sentences.chinese: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？

sentences.english: The first attack started just after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 刚过午夜，第一波进攻开始了。

sentences.english: David went to bed straight after (=  immediately after  ) supper.
sentences.chinese: 戴维一吃完晚饭就去睡觉了。

sentences.english: After you’d called the police, what did you do?
sentences.chinese: 报警之后，你做了些什么？

sentences.english: Zimmerman changed his name after he left Germany.
sentences.chinese: 齐默尔曼离开德国后改了名字。

sentences.english: People still remember the 1958 revolution and what came after (=  happened after it  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们依然记得1958年的那场革命和之后发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular event or time has happened, or when someone has done something

sentences.english: After several delays we finally took off at six o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 几经耽搁后，我们终于在六点起飞了。

sentences.english: Finally, Karpov cracked under the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 最后，卡尔波夫承受不住压力崩溃了。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time

sentences.english: He wore spectacles perched on the very end of his nose.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼镜架在鼻尖上。

sentences.english: The end of the pencil snapped.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔的笔尖啪的一声断了。

sentences.english: Jo joined the end of the line.
sentences.chinese: 乔排到了队尾。

sentences.english: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.
sentences.chinese: 她为了实现自己的目标，什么都会去做。

sentences.english: The road ends here.
sentences.chinese: 这条路到此为止。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
to finish; to make sth finish

sentences.english: We’re good buddies.
sentences.chinese: 我们是好朋友。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伙伴，好朋友；密友；小男孩
detailed_translations.english: a friend

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

sentences.english: Would you mind if I closed the window?
sentences.chinese: 我把窗户关上你不介意吧？

sentences.english: She closed the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 她拉上了窗帘。

sentences.english: Let me do the car door – it won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 我来修一下车门，它关不紧。

sentences.english: Beth closed her eyes and tried to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝合上眼睛想睡觉。

sentences.english: She heard the door close behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她听见门在她身后关上了。

sentences.english: I will now close the meeting by asking you to join me in a final toast.
sentences.chinese: 现在我要请大家最后干一杯来结束这次会议。

detailed_translations.english: to shut something in order to cover an opening, or to become shut in this way

name: old
trans: 多年的, 长时间的, 旧交的

sentences.english: an old man
sentences.chinese: 一位老人

sentences.english: How old are you?
sentences.chinese: 你多大年纪？

sentences.english: Are you older than Sally?
sentences.chinese: 你比萨莉大吗？

sentences.english: You’re old enough to get your own breakfast now.
sentences.chinese: 你现在已经长大，可以自己弄早餐了。

sentences.english: I’m not coming skating. I’m too old for that now.
sentences.chinese: 我不去玩溜冰，我现在太老玩不动了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is old has lived for a very long time

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

sentences.english: I’ll have to ask my boss for a day off.
sentences.chinese: 我得向老板请一天假。

sentences.english: Since I’m my own boss (=  I work for myself, rather than for an employer  ) , my hours are flexible.
sentences.chinese: 我自己当老板，所以我的时间很灵活。

sentences.english: Five-year-old girls love to boss people around.
sentences.chinese: 五岁的女孩就爱支使别人。

detailed_translations.english: the person who employs you or who is in charge of you at work
to tell people to do things, give them orders etc, especially when you have no authority to do it

name: manager
trans: 主管, 经理, 负责人

sentences.english: one of our regional managers
sentences.chinese: 我们的一位地区经理

sentences.english: a middle manager in a computer company
sentences.chinese: 一家计算机公司的中层管理人员

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to manage part or all of a company or other organization

sentences.english: I didn’t really know your name – it was just a lucky guess.
sentences.chinese: 我并不知道你的名字―只是运气好猜中的。

sentences.english: a lucky charm
sentences.chinese: 吉祥符

detailed_translations.english: having good luck

sentences.english: We need to get this finished as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须尽快完成此事。

sentences.english: Kids grow up so quickly these days.
sentences.chinese: 现在的孩子长得真快啊。

detailed_translations.english: fast

name: really
trans: 真实地, 真正地, 实际上

sentences.english: Why don’t you tell us what really happened?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不把真相告诉我们？

sentences.english: Oliver’s not really her brother.
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗其实不是她弟弟。

sentences.english: I never know what he’s really thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我从来都不知道他的真实想法。

sentences.english: She seems unfriendly at first, but she’s really very nice.
sentences.chinese: 一开始她似乎并不友善，但其实她人很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 真正地， 实际上； 很， 十分， 全然
detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about what actually happened or is true, rather than what people might wrongly think

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

name: broken
trans: 被破坏的, 受伤的, 断裂的

sentences.english: Mind the broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 当心碎玻璃。

sentences.english: a badly broken leg
sentences.chinese: 严重骨折的腿

sentences.english: Gibbs had an X-ray, which revealed no broken bones.
sentences.chinese: 吉布斯拍了X光片，显示没有骨折。

detailed_translations.english: in small pieces because it has been hit, dropped etc

name: positive
trans: 积极的, 有助益的, 建设性的

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

sentences.english: I am feeling very depressed.
sentences.chinese: 我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Suddenly I felt a sharp pain in my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 我突然感到肩部一阵剧痛。

sentences.english: I felt as if all my strength had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得好象自己的力气已经全没了。

sentences.english: I felt like I was being kicked in the teeth every day.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉我好像每天都在经受挫折。

detailed_translations.english: If you feel a particular emotion or physical sensation, you experience it
to give you a particular physical feeling, especially when you touch or hold something

sentences.english: She told me a surprising thing.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉我一件令人吃惊的事。

sentences.english: A surprising number of his paintings have survived.
sentences.chinese: 他的存世画作多得出奇。

sentences.english: It is hardly surprising that new mothers often suffer from depression.
sentences.chinese: 初为人母者常患上抑郁症是不足为奇的。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or unexpected

detailed_translations.chinese: 使惊奇；意外发现（surprise的ing形式）

sentences.english: Ken had an accident at work and had to go to hospital.
sentences.chinese: 肯在工作中出了事故，不得不去医院。

sentences.english: I had a slight accident with your coffee.
sentences.chinese: 出了个小小的意外，我把你的咖啡弄洒了。

sentences.english: a train accident
sentences.chinese: 火车事故

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone is injured or something is damaged without anyone intending them to be

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

name: unexpected
trans: 意外的, 料想不到的, 突然的

sentences.english: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.chinese: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.english: Her death was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 她的死完全出人意料。

sentences.english: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

sentences.english: The governor found himself at the center of a political storm .
sentences.chinese: 州长发现自己处于一场政治风暴的中心。

sentences.english: An angry crowd stormed the embassy.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的人群突然袭击大使馆。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people suddenly express very strong feelings about something that someone has said or done
to suddenly attack and enter a place using a lot of force

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

sentences.english: a huge outdoor market
sentences.chinese: 一个规模庞大的露天市场

sentences.english: outdoor recreational activities
sentences.chinese: 户外娱乐活动

sentences.english: outdoor clothing
sentences.chinese: 户外装

sentences.english: a healthy outdoor life
sentences.chinese: 有益健康的户外生活

detailed_translations.english: existing, happening, or used outside, not inside a building

sentences.english: No Parking (= used on signs )
sentences.chinese: 禁止停车

sentences.english: a £45 parking fine
sentences.chinese: 45英镑的违章停车罚款

detailed_translations.english: the act of parking a car or other vehicle

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: variety
trans: 变化, 种种, 多样性

sentences.english: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid
sentences.chinese: 兰花的稀有品种

detailed_translations.english: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting

sentences.english: Andy’s doing a one-year journalism course.
sentences.chinese: 安迪正在修读为期一年的新闻课程。

sentences.english: During the course of our conversation, it emerged that Bob had been in prison.
sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

sentences.english: The main reason for living in Spain is the weather.
sentences.chinese: 居住在西班牙的主要原因是天气。

sentences.english: What do you consider to be the main problem?
sentences.chinese: 你认为最主要的问题是什么？

sentences.english: Our main concern is that the children are safe.
sentences.chinese: 我们最关心的是保证孩子们的安全。

sentences.english: a summary of the main points of the agreement
sentences.chinese: 协议要点的总结

sentences.english: the main aim of the meeting
sentences.chinese: 会议的要旨

sentences.english: I’ll meet you outside the main entrance.
sentences.chinese: 我在大门外等你。

sentences.english: the main bedroom
sentences.chinese: 主卧室

detailed_translations.english: larger or more important than all other things, ideas etc of the same kind

sentences.english: He had even put mousse in his hair.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至还往头发上抹了摩丝。

detailed_translations.english: a substance full of small bubbles that you put in your hair to make it look thicker or to hold its style in place

sentences.english: We had soup as a starter , followed by steak.
sentences.chinese: 我们的第一道菜是汤，接下来是牛排。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起动机；发令员；第一道菜；发射装置；发起者；参加比赛者，上场队员
detailed_translations.english: a small amount of food eaten at the start of a meal before the main part

sentences.english: He kissed the tip of her nose.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的鼻尖。

sentences.english: gardening tips
sentences.chinese: 园艺小窍门

sentences.english: Did you leave a tip ?
sentences.chinese: 你留小费了吗？

sentences.english: His helmet had tipped forward and the boy pushed it back.
sentences.chinese: 头盔向前耷拉下来，男孩把它往后推了推。

detailed_translations.english: the end of something, especially something pointed
to move into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other, or to make something do this
